title: European Union (Withdrawal) Bill: Committee of the whole House Amdt 120
friendly_description: A vote on an amendment to ensure that a referendum on the terms of the exit deal has to be held before March 2019.

title: European Union (Withdrawal) Bill: Committee of the whole House New Clause 54
friendly_description: A vote on a new clause

title: European Union (Withdrawal) Bill: Committee of the whole House New Clause 44
friendly_description: A vote on a new clause which would require an independent evaluation of the impact of the Act upon the health and social care sector to be made after consulting the Scottish Ministers, the Welsh ministers and the relevant Northern Ireland department, service providers, those requiring health and social care services and others.

title: European Union (Withdrawal) Bill: Committee of the whole House Amdt 349
friendly_description: An amendment to prevent Ministers using delegated powers to create criminal offences which carry custodial sentences.

title: European Union (Withdrawal) Bill: Committee of the whole House Amdts 381 and 399
friendly_description: A vote on Government amendments 381 and 399 relating to the date and definition of exit day

title: European Union (Withdrawal) Bill: Committee of the whole House New Clause 13
friendly_description: A vote on a new clause which would ensure that provisions allowing the UK to remain a member of the Customs Union, set out in section 5 of the European Communities Act 1972 but set to be repealed by section 1 of  will be enacted ahead of exit day.

title: Draft Combined Authorities (Mayoral Elections) (Amendment) Order 2017
Draft Local Authorities (Mayoral Elections) (England and Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 2017
Finance (No 2) Bill Committee of the whole House New Clause 8
Finance (No 2) Bill: Committee of the whole House: New Clause 6
Finance (No. 2) Bill: Committee of the whole House New Clause 4
friendly_description: A vote on New Clause 4 which would require a review to be published prior to the Autumn 2018 Budget on the impact of the relief for first-time buyers, including its effects on house prices and on the supply of housing.
friendly_title: Finance (No. 2) Bill: Committee of the whole House New Clause 4

title: Finance (No. 2) Bill: Committee of the whole House New Clause 1
friendly_description: A vote on New Clause 1 which would require the Government to carry out a review of the bank levy, including its effectiveness in relation to its stated aims, the revenue effects of the changes made in 2015 and the comparable effectiveness of the bank payroll tax.
friendly_title: Finance (No. 2) Bill: Committee of the whole House New Clause 1

title: Finance (No. 2) Bill: Committee of the whole House Schedule 9
friendly_description: A vote on Schedule 9 to the Bill which makes changes to the bank levy.
friendly_title: Finance (No. 2) Bill: Committee of the whole House Schedule 9

title: European Union (Withdrawal) Bill: Committee of the whole House Amdt 26
friendly_description: A vote on amendment 26 to Clause 8 which would prevent the Government using delegated powers under Clause 8 to reduce rights or protections.

title: European Union (Withdrawal) Bill: Committee of the whole House New Clause 22
friendly_description: A vote on new clause 22

title: European Union (Withdrawal) Bill: Committee of the whole House New Clause 1
friendly_description: A vote on a new clause to require  a Commons committee to work alongside the Lords Secondary Legislation Scrutiny Committee to determine the level of scrutiny each statutory instrument shall receive.

title: European Union (Withdrawal) Bill: Committee of the whole House Amdt 241
friendly_description: A vote on an amendment to Clause 9 that would require the Secretary of State to publish a strategy for seeking to ensure that reciprocal healthcare arrangements continue after the UK leaves the EU.

title: European Union (Withdrawal) Bill: Committee of the whole House Amdt 30
European Union (Withdrawal) Bill: Committee of the whole House Amdt 7
friendly_description: A vote on amendment 7 to Clause 9 of the Bill which would require the final deal with the EU to be approved by statute passed by Parliament.

title: European Union (Withdrawal) Bill: Committee of the whole House Amendment 25
friendly_description: A vote on Amendment 25 which would prevent the Government’s using delegated powers under Clause 7 to reduce rights or protections.
friendly_title: European Union (Withdrawal) Bill: Committee of the whole House Amendment 25

title: European Union (Withdrawal) Bill: Committee of the whole House Amendment 158
friendly_description: A vote on amendment 158 which would prevent the powers of a Minister of the Crown under Clause 7 of the Bill to fix problems in retained EU law from being exercised to amend the Scotland Act 1998 or the Government of Wales Act 2006.
friendly_title: European Union (Withdrawal) Bill: Committee of the whole House Amendment 158

title: European Union (Withdrawal) Bill: Committee of the whole House Amendment 124
friendly_description: A vote on Amendment 124 which is intended to prevent the regulation-making powers being used to create barriers to the UK’s continued membership of the single market.
friendly_title: European Union (Withdrawal) Bill: Committee of the whole House Amendment 124

title: European Union (Withdrawal) Bill: Committee of the whole House Amendment 49
friendly_description: A vote on Amendment 49 which would place a general provision on the face of the Bill to the effect that the delegated powers granted by the Bill should be used only so far as necessary.
friendly_title: European Union (Withdrawal) Bill: Committee of the whole House Amendment 49

title: European Union (Withdrawal) Bill: Committee of the whole House New Clause 63
friendly_description: A vote on New Clause 63 which would require the Government to establish new domestic governance arrangements following the UK’s exit from the EU for environmental standards and protections, following consultation.
friendly_title: European Union (Withdrawal) Bill: Committee of the whole House New Clause 63

title: Finance (No 2) Bill: Second Reading
Finance (No.2) Bill Second Reading: Jeremy Corbyn's amendment
European Union (Withdrawal) Bill: Committee of the whole House Amdt 339
friendly_description: A vote on amendment 339 in the name of the Leader of the Opposition to remove the power of public authorities to levy fees or charges via tertiary legislation.

title: European Union (Withdrawal) Bill: Committee of the whole House New Clause 80
friendly_description: A vote on New Clause 80 in the name of the Leader of the Opposition to ensure that any financial settlement as part of leaving the EU must reflect obligations incurred by the UK during its membership of the EU, must be transparent and must be approved by Parliament

title: European Union (Withdrawal) Bill: Committee of the whole House New Clause 17
friendly_description: A vote on New Clause 17 in the name of Mr Chris Leslie to prevent the Government from making a payment in settlement of the UK's withdrawal from the European Union as part of a withdrawal agreement or new Treaty unless it has been approved by the House of Commons

title: European Union (Withdrawal) Bill Committee of the whole House Amendment 167
European Union (Withdrawal) Bill Committee of the whole House Clause 11 and Schedule 3 stand part
European Union (Withdrawal) Bill Committee of the whole House Amendment 72
European Union (Withdrawal) Bill Committee of the whole House Amendment 42
European Union (Withdrawal) Bill Committee of the whole House New Clause 64
Closure Motion: Parliamentary Constituencies (Amendment Bill)
friendly_description: A vote 'That the question be now put' in order to bring an end to the current debate and allow a decision to be reached on the matter being debated.

title: Motion to sit in private
